channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Cold Diffusion: Inverting Arbitrary Image Transforms Without Noise
item.description: We observe that the generative behavior of diffusion models is not strongly dependent on the choice of image degradation, and in fact an entire family of generative models can be constructed by varying this choice.

item.title: An Image is Worth One Word: Personalizing Text-to-Image Generation using Textual Inversion
item.description: Yet, it is unclear how such freedom can be exercised to generate images of specific unique concepts, modify their appearance, or compose them in new roles and novel scenes.

item.title: NeuMan: Neural Human Radiance Field from a Single Video
item.description: Photorealistic rendering and reposing of humans is important for enabling augmented reality experiences.

item.title: Interactive Multi-Class Tiny-Object Detection
item.description: We perform experiments on the Tiny-DOTA and LCell datasets using both two-stage and one-stage object detection architectures to verify the efficacy of our approach.

item.title: PAConv: Position Adaptive Convolution with Dynamic Kernel Assembling on Point Clouds
item.description: The key of PAConv is to construct the convolution kernel by dynamically assembling basic weight matrices stored in Weight Bank, where the coefficients of these weight matrices are self-adaptively learned from point positions through ScoreNet.

item.title: Musika! Fast Infinite Waveform Music Generation
item.description: We release the source code and pretrained autoencoder weights at github. com/marcoppasini/musika, such that a GAN can be trained on a new music domain with a single GPU in a matter of hours.

item.title: Text-Guided Synthesis of Artistic Images with Retrieval-Augmented Diffusion Models
item.description: In RDMs, a set of nearest neighbors is retrieved from an external database during training for each training instance, and the diffusion model is conditioned on these informative samples.

item.title: Instant Neural Graphics Primitives with a Multiresolution Hash Encoding
item.description: Neural graphics primitives, parameterized by fully connected neural networks, can be costly to train and evaluate.

item.title: Can Language Models Make Fun? A Case Study in Chinese Comical Crosstalk
item.description: However, the humor aspect of natural language is relatively under-investigated, especially in the age of pre-trained language models.

item.title: Improving Diffusion Model Efficiency Through Patching
item.description: Diffusion models are a powerful class of generative models that iteratively denoise samples to produce data.

item.title: A Walk in the Park: Learning to Walk in 20 Minutes With Model-Free Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Deep reinforcement learning is a promising approach to learning policies in uncontrolled environments that do not require domain knowledge.

item.title: LLM.int8(): 8-bit Matrix Multiplication for Transformers at Scale
item.description: We develop a procedure for Int8 matrix multiplication for feed-forward and attention projection layers in transformers, which cut the memory needed for inference by half while retaining full precision performance.

item.title: Language models enable zero-shot prediction of the effects of mutations on protein function
item.description: Modeling the effect of sequence variation on function is a fundamental problem for understanding and designing proteins.

item.title: YOLOV: Making Still Image Object Detectors Great at Video Object Detection
item.description: On the positive side, the detection in a certain frame of a video, compared with in a still image, can draw support from other frames.

item.title: Nyströmformer: A Nyström-Based Algorithm for Approximating Self-Attention
item.description: The scalability of Nystr\"{o}mformer enables application to longer sequences with thousands of tokens.

item.title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
item.description: YOLOv7 surpasses all known object detectors in both speed and accuracy in the range from 5 FPS to 160 FPS and has the highest accuracy 56. 8% AP among all known real-time object detectors with 30 FPS or higher on GPU V100.

item.title: Multi-scale Multi-band DenseNets for Audio Source Separation
item.description: This paper deals with the problem of audio source separation.

item.title: Evaluating Large Language Models Trained on Code
item.description: We introduce Codex, a GPT language model fine-tuned on publicly available code from GitHub, and study its Python code-writing capabilities.

item.title: Thin-Plate Spline Motion Model for Image Animation
item.description: Firstly, we propose thin-plate spline motion estimation to produce a more flexible optical flow, which warps the feature maps of the source image to the feature domain of the driving image.

item.title: LMOT: Efficient Light-Weight Detection and Tracking in Crowds
item.description: This paper introduces a novel real-time model, LMOT, i. e., Light-weight Multi-Object Tracker, that performs joint pedestrian detection and tracking.
